item.title: Links to useful R resources
item.description: Here are some useful links and resources for R programming. General Rstudio Community: forum and discussions organized by macro-topic. Rseek: a sort of wiki R page! From rstudioconf2019: a collection of R resources by @littlemissdata Cheatsheets: self-explanatory WTF.. or “What They Forgot to Teach You About R” ðŸ˜‰ Another life-changing guide from Jenny Bryan Google’s R Style Guide Project Management Best Practices Handling Packages R-Bloggers blog (scroll to) reference: collection of links… analytical work reproducibly using R: Pre-print article Karl Broman slides Joris Muller’s Blog on The “ten simple rules for reproducible computational research” in R Joris Muller’s Blog on A basic reproducible data analysis workflow - principles R studio TERMINAL Great post Using rstudio-terminal/ More on Using the RStudio Terminal DATABASES Databases using R RStudio list API & R Amanda Gadrow Resources Saving tokens Various Ways Saving tokens WTF… to tell you ggplot2 & GRAPHS Great line by line tutorial ggplot flipbook Modern Dive Chapter Grammar of Graphics Table Packages to discover DataExplorer EDA, See github Formattable Tables, See more info table1 Tables, See more info ggstatsplot Graphs, See more info Extension of ggplot2 package for creating graphics with details from statistical tests included in the plots themselves and targeted primarily at behavioral sciences community.
